title: [feature request] Filter output icon
author: eunito
body_snippet:
Possibility to search content in the output using a toolbar icon

## Expected Behavior
If a user wants to search for a key in the terminal output not inside a file if there was a search icon the user could filter that keyword...

## Current Behavior
Currently the only way is to copy paste the content into a text editor and filter the key there...

## Possible Solution
Creation of a search/filter output icon.

iterations.description: Valid UX enhancement to add a visual indicator icon when connection output filtering is active, improving discoverability of the filter state.

comments.author: sparerd
comments.snippet:
I'm not sure how feasible this will be at the moment. mRemoteNG isn't a terminal program and doesn't have direct access to the content coming from ssh sessions. We use PuTTY to connect and display terminal/ssh information and just make it draw itself within our window.

This feature request isn't impossible, but is highly dependent on #181. We would need to create our own terminal within mRemoteNG for this to be possible.

notes:
AI triage (claude): Valid UX enhancement to add a visual indicator icon when connection output filtering is active, improving discoverability of the filter state.
Approach: Add a small filter/funnel icon to the output toolbar that toggles visibility or highlights when a filter is active; update toolbar initialization and filter toggle handler to set icon state.
